newsitem.title: ITALY: Italy local debt exposure 63.9 trln lire in 1995.
newsitem.headline: Italy local debt exposure 63.9 trln lire in 1995.

text.p: The debt exposure of Italian local authorities in 1995 to public and private banks totalled 63.9 trillion lire, the Treasury Ministry said in a statement on Saturday.
It said 9.795 trillion lire of that debt was due to loans for public works, 8.036 trillion of which went to local authorities and the remaining 1.759 trillion to regional and provincial bodies.

The northeast region of Piedmont received the largest per capita chunk of credit in 1995 -- 318,200 lire -- followed by the southern region of Basilicata (217,400) and the northeast Valle d'Aosta (215,200). -- Rome newsroom +396 678 2505
